results.title: New romance
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bill Brind, Janet Walczewski and Susan Gabori
results.brief_description: Finely drawn study of the social aspects of heterosexual and homosexual relationships and asks whether people have a right to think, feel and act differently. Excellent use of locational interviews, cartoons and meaningful dialogue and opens up a subject that is often misunderstood.

results.title: New pulse of life - Rev. ed.
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Robert Berk
results.brief_description: Presents latest basic life support principles and techniques for cardiopulmonary resuscitation, as recommended by the National Research Council. Live subjects, mannequins, audio visual aids and animation are used to demonstrate A - Airway opened, B - Breathing restored and C - Circulation restored. Physiological background and dramatic CPR re-enactments are provided. The revised version does not contain a demonstration of the precordial thump or a witnessed cardiac arrest. The precordial thump should only be used in conjunction with an ECG monitoring machine.

results.title: New pulse of life
results.brief_description: Demonstrates procedures for restoring heartbeat and breathing in the first crucial minutes after a heart attack by re-enacting typical cases and showing correct methods of action. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: New paths to learning
results.creator_credit: Space Age Images and Litton Industries Broadcast
results.brief_description: The electronic age is revolutionising teaching. Oakland Community College in Michigan worked with Litton Industries to develop an automated system to enable a student to take their course at a time convenient to them. The College provides programmed instruction in a variety of subjects for people of all ages over a period of 14 hours each day. An automated cubicle in an audio-tutorial laboratory replaces the usual classroom.

results.title: New Orleans mardi gras
results.brief_description:
Some say the happiest day in New Orleans is Shrove Tuesday. And it is a day that stands for the entire carnival season with its Mardi Gras carnival parade. In this film the theme of the procession is “Toys” and every float is a variation on that theme. the people of the Algiers stage their parade on the broad waters of the Mississippi.
Completely planned, financed and executed with thirty or more secret organisations - a great deal of the activities are directed by tradition.

results.title: New Norcia. New Norcia voices (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and A. Bruce Hodsdon
results.brief_description: A compilation of two companion films. ‘New Norcia’ (23 mins. 1990) is a representation through images and journal extracts of the history of contact between European and Aboriginal cultures, circa 1850-1900 at the Benedictine Mission at New Norcia in Western Australia. ‘New Norcia Voices’ (19 mins. 1992) combines interviews with a monk at the monastery, historians, and men and women who were brought-up at the mission. Each brings a different perspective to the legend of the founder Bishop Salvado, the legacy of the Mission and what this might mean today.’New Norcia’ narrated by Ian Taylor.

results.title: New Norcia (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and A. Bruce Hodsdon
results.brief_description: This documentary explores the contact between European and Aboriginal cultures which occurred at the Benedictine community in New Norcia, Western Australia around 1850-1900. Extracts from the journal of the founder of the monastery Bishop Rosendo Salvado and photographs taken at New Norcia at the time are used to represent the history of the abbey and the contact between the cultures that occurred there.

results.title: New nation in the West Indies. Part 1. Background to federation
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Ian MacNeill
results.brief_description: Part one of New Nation in the West Indies is an introduction to the Federation of the West Indies. Ten palm-shaded island units, popularly regarded as tourist paradises, have pooled their resources for a common future. What are their problems, hopes and aspirations as they embark on this new chapter in their history? The film presents the views of several spokesmen, notably Hugh Springer, Registrar of the University College of the West Indies, and the Honorable Norman Manley, Chief Minister of Jamaica, who describes the historical, political and economic motivations that led to the union.

results.title: New man on the land: tomorrows harvest
results.creator_credit: BMT Visuals, Massey-Ferguson Ltd and Godfrey Baseley
results.brief_description: Modern methods of farming have dispensed with much of the toil and drudgery often associated with agricultural labor. Shows the importance of training for young farm-workers, and of the older generation accepting a business-like approach to farm management and the use of modern techniques. What this means in human terms for one group of farmers in Britain is described when the film visits West-hide Farm in Herefordshire.
